intro: Rubus caesius var. rivalis, commonly known as the red raspberry bush, is a thorny shrub native to eastern North America. It produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when mature, though they may also be yellow or orange depending on the variety. The plant has pinnately compound leaves with serrated edges and is often found in woodland edges and thickets. It is a member of the Rosaceae family and is valued for its edible berries and ornamental appeal. The plant is also used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
